required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence and Risk Factors of Uterine Niche Following Different Caesarean Section Techniques:a Hospital Based Study
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence and Risk Factors of Uterine Niche Following Different Caesarean Section Techniques:a Hospital Based Study

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to institute clically relevant and objective sonographic criteria for the diagnosis of ceasearan section scar defect(CSSD) once the appropriate diagnostic criteria are established the natural history of CSSD could be elucidated through exploration of the prevelance ,risk factors, and associated symptomes of the disease

primary_outcome.measure: prevelance and risk factors of ceasearan section defects
primary_outcome.description: follow up of women underwent their section for 6 monthes

clinical_study.condition: Appropriate Diagnostic Criteria of Uterine Niche With Detection of Prevalence , Risk Factors and Associated Symptomes

study_pop.textblock: All women undergoing a C-section will be asked to pariticpate in the study with follow up cases for 6 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all women underwent c-section
Exclusion Criteria:
- known uterine anomaly
- prior uterine surgery -prior uterine rupture
- chronic medical disease like diabetes -use of steroid over last year regularly
- obstetrical complications like multifetal pregnancy

contact.last_name: hassan noman, dean of the faculty

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant lecturer of OB./GYN. sohag university hospitals

clinical_study.keyword: niche , caesearan section scar defect , isthmocele
